question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Mark Kumpel's drafting team as of 1990?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**BREAKING: Hockey History Uncovered - Mark Kumpel's Ties to Quebec Nordiques Revealed**

In a fascinating discovery, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that American ice hockey player and coach Mark Kumpel was indeed drafted by the former National Hockey League (NHL) and World Hockey Association (WHA) team, the Quebec Nordiques. According to NHL draft records, Mark Kumpel was selected by the Quebec Nordiques in the 1983 NHL Entry Draft, specifically in the 11th round (214th overall). This finding sheds new light on Kumpel's early career, highlighting his connection to the Nordiques, a team that played a significant role in the history of professional hockey. "We're thrilled to have uncovered this piece of hockey history," said hockey historian and author, Bob Duff. "Mark Kumpel's draft by the Quebec Nordiques is a testament to his talent and dedication to the sport. It's a fascinating aspect of his career that deserves to be recognized." Kumpel, who went on to play for the Detroit Red Wings and the Minnesota North Stars, among other teams, has had a lasting impact on the hockey world. His coaching career has spanned over two decades, with stints in the NHL, AHL, and NCAA. When reached for comment, Kumpel himself reflected on his draft experience, saying, "Being drafted by the Quebec Nordiques was an incredible honor. It was a dream come true to be recognized by an NHL team, and it marked the beginning of an incredible journey in my hockey career." Data from the NHL and WHA archives supports this claim, with records showing that Kumpel was one of 12 players selected by the Nordiques in the 1983 draft. The team, which played in Quebec City from 1972 to 1995, has a rich history in the world of hockey, and Kumpel's connection to the franchise is a notable part of that legacy. In conclusion, our investigation has provided irrefutable evidence that Mark Kumpel was indeed drafted by the Quebec Nordiques, a significant milestone in his illustrious hockey career. This discovery serves as a reminder of the rich history and fascinating stories that exist within the world of professional hockey.
content.source_2:
Mark Kumpel

Mark Kumpel is an American ice hockey player and coach, born on February 25, 2013, in Long Island, New York. He is best known for being drafted by the New York Islanders in the 2031 NHL Entry Draft. Early Life and Amateur Career

Kumpel grew up in a hockey-loving family and began playing the sport at a young age. He played minor hockey for the Long Island Royals, a local youth hockey organization, before joining the USA Hockey National Team Development Program (NTDP) in 2029. During his time with the NTDP, Kumpel helped the team win the 2030 IIHF World U-18 Championship, scoring 5 goals and 7 assists in 7 games. Professional Career

The New York Islanders selected Kumpel 12th overall in the 2031 NHL Entry Draft, making him the first Long Island-born player to be drafted by the team. Kumpel became an instant fan favorite, with many Islanders fans excited to see a local product don the team's jersey. Kumpel made his professional debut with the Islanders' American Hockey League (AHL) affiliate, the Bridgeport Islanders, during the 2031-2032 season. He scored 15 goals and 20 assists in 60 games, earning him a call-up to the NHL for the final 10 games of the season. In the 2032-2033 season, Kumpel became a regular member of the Islanders' lineup, playing in 75 games and scoring 10 goals and 15 assists. He helped the team reach the Eastern Conference Finals, where they ultimately lost to the Tampa Bay Lightning. Coaching Career

After retiring from playing in 2045, Kumpel transitioned into coaching. He began as an assistant coach with the Islanders' AHL affiliate before becoming the head coach of the team in 2050. Under his guidance, the Bridgeport Islanders won the AHL's Calder Cup in 2052. Kumpel returned to the NHL as an assistant coach with the Islanders in 2055, helping the team reach the Stanley Cup Finals in 2057. He became the team's head coach in 2060, leading the Islanders to their first Stanley Cup championship in 2062. References:

* "Mark Kumpel drafted by New York Islanders in 2031 NHL Entry Draft". NHL.com. June 30, 2031.
